snippet: The president of the police officers’ union delivered a strong defense Tuesday, asserting the actions did not amount to a chokehold.
abstract: Richard D Emery, new chairman of New York City's police oversight board, faults Police Department for its handling of officers found to have used chokeholds--banned tactic that medical examiner says led to death of Eric Garner in police custody; Patrick J Lynch, president of police officers union, defends police and says actions did not amount to a chokehold.

byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN

lead_paragraph: The president of the police officers’ union delivered a strong defense Tuesday, asserting the actions did not amount to a chokehold.

headline.main: Handling of New York Chokehold Cases ‘Disappointing,’ Review Board Chief Says
headline.print_headline: Handling of Chokehold Cases ‘Disappointing,’ Review Board Chief Says
